adjectives.description: applicative (comparative more applicative, superlative most applicative)

entries.meaning: (computing) Of a programming language: using successive functional transformations on data to arrive at a result.
Involving the application of an operator on an operand.
(grammar) A grammatical construct that casts a peripheral noun phrase as direct object.
examples: It remains a puzzle why some languages allow multiple applicatives while others prohibit them. In Salish, examples of multiple applicatives are attested in Columbian, Lushootseed, Tillamook, and the three Northern Interior languages.
